page.title: 09Carlisle Covered Market
page.content: There are entrances from Scotch St (opposite{the Lanes}),Fisher St (where you also get into the Fish Market),and West Tower St. Above the Fisher St doors are carved stone animal heads representing the meats on sale inside, while the internal iron roofwork is typical of Victorian engineering. Cowans, Sheldon & Co built the Market in the late 1880's. Over 60 stalls offer a range of goods:{Cumberland}sausage, ham, and rum butter; fruit & vegetables; cut flowers; hardware; footwear including trainers, Doc Martens (calf high lace-up boots favoured by male teen- agers), & court shoes; electrical sockets, plugs, & bulbs; audio & video tapes; knitting & crochet yarns.The Market is open 8.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. daily except Sunday and Thursday afternoon.
